question: BLAST.tv Austin Major: paiN vs. The MongolZ
description:
paiN and The MongolZ are scheduled to play each other in the semifinals of the BLAST.tv Austin Major Tournament on June 21, 2025, at 6:30 PM ET.

This market will resolve to “paiN” if paiN win against The MongolZ in the semifinals of the BLAST.tv Austin Major Tournament.

This market will resolve to “The MongolZ” if The MongolZ win against paiN in the semifinals of the BLAST.tv Austin Major Tournament.

If the match ends in a tie, is canceled, or delayed beyond June 28, 2025, this market will resolve to 50‑50.

The resolution source for this market will be official information from the HLTV (https://www.hltv.org/events/7902/blasttv-austin-major-2025)

question: Orioles vs. Yankees
description:
In the upcoming MLB game, scheduled for June 22 at 11:35AM ET:
If the Baltimore Orioles win, the market will resolve to “Orioles”.
If the New York Yankees win, the market will resolve to “Yankees”.
If the game is postponed, this market will remain open until the game has been completed.
If the game is canceled entirely, with no make-up game, this market will resolve 50-50.
To know when a postponed game will be played, please check the home team's schedule on MLB.com for the listed team and look for the game described as a makeup game.

question: Will the price of Bitcoin be less than $102K on June 22 at 5PM ET?
description:
This market will resolve according to the final "Close" price of the Binance 1 minute candle for BTC/USDT on the time and date specified in the title. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source for this market is Binance, specifically the BTC/USDT "Close" prices currently available at https://www.binance.com/en/trade/BTC_USDT with "1m" and "Candles" selected on the top bar.

If the reported value falls exactly between two brackets, then this market will resolve to the higher range bracket.

Please note that this market is about the price according to Binance BTC/USDT, not according to other sources or spot markets.

Please note that this market is about the price according to Binance ETH/USDT, not according to other sources or spot markets.

question: Will Andrew Cuomo’s vote share be less than 35% in the first round of the NYC Democratic mayoral primary?
description:
This market will resolve according to the first round ranked-choice vote share for Andrew Cuomo in the 2025 Democratic primary for Mayor of New York City, scheduled for June 24, 2025.

If the reported value falls exactly between two brackets, then this market will resolve to the higher range bracket.

This market will resolve based on the official certified results of the first RCV round as published by the New York City Board of Elections.

If a recount is initiated prior to certification, the market will remain open until the recount is completed and results are certified. A recount initiated after certification will not affect market resolution.

question: Will turnout be less than 900000 in the NYC Democratic mayoral primary?
description:
This market will resolve based on the total number of votes cast in the 2025 New York City Democratic mayoral primary election, scheduled for June 24, 2025.

If the reported value falls exactly between two brackets, this market will resolve to the higher range bracket.

The primary resolution source for this market will be the Certified Summary Report published by the New York City Board of Elections on its official website (https://vote.nyc).

If the election is postponed, canceled, or if certified results are not released, this market will remain open until the total number of votes cast is officially published.

question: Israeli ground operation against Fordow before August?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Israeli military or intelligence personnel directly participate in a ground operation at or targeting Iran's Fordow nuclear facility by July 31, 2025, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to “No”.

To qualify, Israeli personnel must carry out or support a direct operation against the Fordow site with the intent of sabotaging, destroying, or seizing the facility. 

Airstrikes, cyberattacks, standoff weapons, remote sabotage, targeted operations against specific personnel, or operations by proxies or third parties without Israeli ground presence will not qualify.

Actions taken by Israeli military or intelligence personnel on the ground which do not enter the facility and do not directly seek to destroy or sabotage the facility, including the use of ATGMS, loitering munitions, and FPV drones to target air defenses, or surface infrastructure will not alone qualify.    


The primary resolution source for this market will be a consensus of credible reporting.
